section.name: News and Status
section.p: This document contains the latest news and status regarding the JMS CTS project. It is here you'll find announcements related to JMS CTS.

subsection.name: Current Status
subsection.p: We are currently working on JMS CTS 0.5.

subsection.name: February 4, 2004 - JMS CTS 0.5 beta 2 released!
subsection.p:
This includes the following changes since 0.5-b1:
Added coverage of MessageProducer.getTimeToLive() and MessageProducer.setTimeToLive().
Added coverage of section 3.4.7 - JMSRedelivered, as per RFE 817173.
Added coverage of section 3.4.9 - JMSExpiration
Added coverage for message republication, as per RFE 823464
Changed reporting for RFE 826562 - order requirements, test cases in coverage.html
Changed reporting to include stack traces in failure descriptions.
Added coverage of section 3.12 - Provider Implementations of JMS Message Interfaces, as per RFE 867564.
Fixed bug 819193 - Can't filter tests on ack type
Fixed bug 818994 - Errors in test setUp() and tearDown() not reported
Fixed bug 887462 - QueueBrowser should be excluded from connection.stopped test
Fixed bug 879678 - StreamMessageTest.testIncrementalReadBytes() not compliant

subsection.name: October 1, 2003 - JMS CTS 0.5 beta 1 released
subsection.p: After a long incubation, the first public release of JMS CTS is now available.

subsection.name: May, 2003 - JMS CTS moves
subsection.p:
The JMS CTS has moved to a new home,
http://jmscts.sourceforge.net.
It was originally part of the OpenJMS project.
